review_title: It's not pefect, but it's pretty wonderful.
pros: Belmont is a warm place to work. When everything is at it's best, employees are treated wonderfully.
cons: There is little room for advancement or career growth. When there is one dip in any number (whether enrollment, retention, etc.), there is a sense of extreme panic. We should not be complacent by any means, but not every number will be topped year to year, and that should not be seen as a failure.

review_title: To much politics, not enough Jesus
job_title: Computer & Simulation Technician in Nashville, TN
pros: It was Better than being unemployed.
cons: I assumed because it was a "Christian" university it would be a good place to work.  I was wrong.  You have to constantly watch your back.  Everything is political.  You either have to correctly identify the cliques and work your way into one or you have to stay below the radar and fend for your self.  There is a web of connections and behind the back chatter that is effectively a minefield.  I did not  fit  in immediately  and did not have a chance.  I was required to use personal resources to complete assignments, I was expected to change my schedule or work extra with little or no notice.  I made every effort to communicate with managers and supervisors to make things work, I was assured that I was doing good work and had nothing to worry about and then two days later came in to find out I didn't have a job.

review_title: This could be a good place to work if they could run it like a business.
job_title: Maintenance Tech II in Nashville, TN
pros: I enjoyed the work I was able to perform.
cons:
Too many people (including students) who act like they are better than you.
Money is wasted through and through and yet the raises are the same for all (at least in my department) no matter what your performance was or the quality of work you performed. Many people in management positions with no interpersonal skills. 
No job training or advancement opportunities (at least in my department).

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: The work was challenging, but I truly enjoyed it. You get to meet a lot of people, help them with answering questions or fixing a problem. Coworkers were nice and friendly. I really nice student job.
cons: The amount of emails sent by the manager. I would receive hundreds of emails about a mistake somebody made, about some documents, about updates, about whatnot. Fighting for shifts with coworkers.

pros: As far as student positions go, Belmont offers a large variety of available opportunities. It's not hard to get employed, and there's lots of ways to get real life work experience here. It's even better if you have a federal work study award.
cons: The pay is always minimum wage for student employment. However, if you work off campus, you make slightly more (to account for gas expenses)

pros: Great co-workers and amazing students in the Art Department. A great place to be as an adjunct and starting a career. Everyone is really welcoming and helpful across the board. Faculty seems genuinely committed to the students as a whole.
cons: The school is always growing so the need for full-time is always there, but unfortunately the funds don't always meet the need. But they're always looking and trying. They honestly do a good job of trying to meet student needs in faculty / teacher ratios but like all schools it takes time.

pros:
Very, very slow times. I could have worked another full time
job along with mine. 

Pay was an increase from my previous jobs
Nice coworkers and managers, directors, etc. 
Highly organized and efficient office
Beautiful campus 
Good benefits and 403b matching
cons: Can be very,  wry slow at times and no ability to do anything to pass time. I could have performed two peoples jobs.

review_title: Great Place to Work - Need More Talent, Though
pros: Great environment, friendly students, caring people.  They really try hard to give you the resources you need to teach.
cons: The University needs more talented Professors.  Adjuncts are still not treated with respect, although they are working on it.

review_title: Micromanaging Supervisor, serious lack of staff for the amount of work
pros: Benefits, tuition discount, free public transportation
cons: No new staff hired to manage the rapid growth of student body; tremendous workload

pros: Great supervisors who are very intentionally in helping you learn and grow as a professional. Many opportunities for professional development and overall positive engagement across campus.
cons: This position is a live-on position where you live in the building where you work. This makes it very difficult to have proper work - life balance.

pros:
Rewarding experience.
Great staff and leadership.

review_title: Few people should be Resident Assistants
pros: This is a great way to get your housing paid for while also learning a great deal about yourself and others. You get out what you put into the job.
cons: It would be nice to have board paid for, but beggars cant be choosers here.

pros: Very accommodating for time off and class schedules, easy work, at many jobs you can do your homework while on the job when things are slow.
cons: the pay is low, minimum wage, you can't work more than 20 hours per week unless you're federal work study

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Nashville, TN

cons: No cons from my perspective , my managers and coworkers were very supportive.
